result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario M Griffin

records.addlTxt: Motion to Reduce Cash Bail to Ten Thousand Dollars.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 07-19-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.
Letter from defendant.  (Mario M. Griffin - #2022008566, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Mario M Griffin not in court.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dianne Margaret Erickson in court. Atty Erickson advises just appointed on the case. Defense needs additional time to obtained discovery and review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Papers from Mario Griffin. Hard copies forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Mario M Griffin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Mario M Griffin in custody.  Daniel Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mario M Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense's motion to withdraw heard. State takes no position. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Mario M Griffin not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests status date. Case adjourned to Br 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mario M Griffin in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Mario M Griffin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Fitting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JJG (11/25/06); Darenda J H.; JG (10/1/09); JH (10/15/14);JG (11/21/07);FW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

11:13 AM Defendant Mario M Griffin in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Mario M Griffin in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
